translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sobhita

analyzed: attha sandassa ka tthera a padāna
translated: The Elder Atthasandassaka’s Birth Story
Sitting in the Visāla Palace,🔽I saw the Leader of the World;
He had destroyed the pollutants, had attained strength,

analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhata  sata sahassā tevijjā
translated: and was in front of the Saṅgha of monks.🔽The three knowledges, the six deep knowledges, the great powers,
a hundred thousand of them;
They surrounded the Buddha,
who, on seeing him, would not be gladdened?
In the world with its gods,
there is no one who can equal his knowledge;
The Buddha, with infinite knowledge,
who, on seeing him, would not be gladdened?
He was teaching the body of the Dhamma,
the sole mine of jewels;
They were unable to fathom him,
who, on seeing him, would not be gladdened?
With these three verses,
Nārada, the eloquent one,
praised Padumuttara,
the undefeated Buddha.
Through that faith in my mind,
and through my praise of the Buddha,
for a hundred thousand eons
I did not go to a bad destination.
Three hundred eons from now,
there will be a warrior named Sumitta;
He will be endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four discriminations,
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā atthasandassako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai atthasandassakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Atthasandassaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Atthasandassaka is the seventh.
